summary: In this study the authors isolated the s4 (serogroup F) strain of the pathogenic bacterium Pasteurella multocida strain from the lungs of infected rabits and subjected it to whole-genome sequencing and comparative analysis for the purposes of understanding the pathogenic variability amongst P. multocida strains.

use_cases.case: The complete genome of B. bronchiseptica RB50 was used by the authors to source the sequences of seven MLST virulence genes for use in producing a neighbour-joining tree including several P. multocida, B. bronchiseptica, and S. aureus strains. This analysis allowed the authors to determine the presence of a common ancestor between P. multocida isolates from their sample and to select the s4 strain for sequencing.
